p: In another study, the Eos showed an important activity on different multiresistant Gram-positive and Gram-negative strains, but no effect was observed on A. baumannii, which is contradictory to our results where all Eos studied have shown an inhibition of bacteria with an MIC value ranging from 10 to 20 μl/ml [ 26], while in Deloer and Bari's study [ 27], the Eo had an important activity with low concentration on various strains with the exception of E. coli where the Eos were not active in all tested concentrations which was different from our findings where the Eos were active on E. coli with a MIC (20 μl/ml). The Eos in Singh et al.'s [ 28] study showed an effect on E. coli, which correlates with the results registrated in our study.
